bind.description: A string to tie the lifecycle to, e.g. the terraform ID of another resource.

private_key.description: A supplied WireGuard private key. By default one is generated.

public_key.description: The public key corresponding to the (given or generated) private key.

block.description: Provides a WireGuard asymmetric key resource. This can be used to create, read, and delete WireGuard keys in terraform state.

addresses.description: IPs (or CIDR) to be assigned to the interface. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

dns.description: IPs or hostnames of Domain Name Servers to set as the interface's DNS search domains. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

mtu.description: Manual MTU to override automatic discovery. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

post_down.description: Scripts to run before tearing down the interface. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

post_up.description: Scripts to run after setting up the interface. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

pre_down.description: Scripts to run before tearing down the interface. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

pre_up.description: Script to run before setting up the interface. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

private_key.description: The base64 private key for this peer's interface.

routing_table.description: Controls the routing table (or "off") to which routes are added. (`wg-quick`/apps only.)

allowed_ips.description: IPs (or CIDR) allowed for traffic to/from this peer.

endpoint.description: An endpoint IP:port or hostname:port at which this peer can be reached initially.

persistent_keepalive.description: Period in seconds (or "off") after which to ping the peer to keep a stateful firewall or NAT mapping valid.

preshared_key.description: A base64 preshared key from this peer.

public_key.description: The base64 public key for this peer.
